java/liquibase/change/MergeColumnChange.java

00001 package liquibase.change;
00002 
00003 import liquibase.database.Database;
00004 import liquibase.database.DerbyDatabase;
00005 import liquibase.database.sql.RawSqlStatement;
00006 import liquibase.database.sql.SqlStatement;
00007 import liquibase.database.structure.Column;
00008 import liquibase.database.structure.DatabaseObject;
00009 import liquibase.database.structure.Table;
00010 import liquibase.exception.UnsupportedChangeException;
00011 import org.w3c.dom.Document;
00012 import org.w3c.dom.Element;
00013 
00014 import java.util.*;
00015 
00019 public class MergeColumnChange extends AbstractChange {
00020 
00021     private String schemaName;
00022     private String tableName;
00023     private String column1Name;
00024     private String joinString;
00025     private String column2Name;
00026     private String finalColumnName;
00027     private String finalColumnType;
00028 
00029     public MergeColumnChange() {
00030         super("mergeColumns", "Merge Column");
00031     }
00032 
00033     public String getSchemaName() {
00034         return schemaName;
00035     }
00036 
00037     public void setSchemaName(String schemaName) {
00038         this.schemaName = schemaName;
00039     }
00040 
00041     public String getTableName() {
00042         return tableName;
00043     }
00044 
00045     public void setTableName(String tableName) {
00046         this.tableName = tableName;
00047     }
00048 
00049     public String getColumn1Name() {
00050         return column1Name;
00051     }
00052 
00053     public void setColumn1Name(String column1Name) {
00054         this.column1Name = column1Name;
00055     }
00056 
00057     public String getJoinString() {
00058         return joinString;
00059     }
00060 
00061     public void setJoinString(String joinString) {
00062         this.joinString = joinString;
00063     }
00064 
00065     public String getColumn2Name() {
00066         return column2Name;
00067     }
00068 
00069     public void setColumn2Name(String column2Name) {
00070         this.column2Name = column2Name;
00071     }
00072 
00073     public String getFinalColumnName() {
00074         return finalColumnName;
00075     }
00076 
00077     public void setFinalColumnName(String finalColumnName) {
00078         this.finalColumnName = finalColumnName;
00079     }
00080 
00081     public String getFinalColumnType() {
00082         return finalColumnType;
00083     }
00084 
00085     public void setFinalColumnType(String finalColumnType) {
00086         this.finalColumnType = finalColumnType;
00087     }
00088 
00089     public SqlStatement[] generateStatements(Database database) throws UnsupportedChangeException {
00090 
00091         List<SqlStatement> statements = new ArrayList<SqlStatement>();
00092 
00093         AddColumnChange addNewColumnChange = new AddColumnChange();
00094         String schemaName = getSchemaName() == null?database.getDefaultSchemaName():getSchemaName();
00095         addNewColumnChange.setSchemaName(schemaName);
00096         addNewColumnChange.setTableName(getTableName());
00097         ColumnConfig columnConfig = new ColumnConfig();
00098         columnConfig.setName(getFinalColumnName());
00099         columnConfig.setType(getFinalColumnType());
00100         addNewColumnChange.addColumn(columnConfig);
00101         statements.addAll(Arrays.asList(addNewColumnChange.generateStatements(database)));
00102 
00103         String updateStatement = "UPDATE " + database.escapeTableName(schemaName, getTableName()) + " SET " + getFinalColumnName() + " = " + database.getConcatSql(getColumn1Name(), "'"+getJoinString()+"'", getColumn2Name());
00104 
00105         statements.add(new RawSqlStatement(updateStatement));
00106 
00107         DropColumnChange dropColumn1Change = new DropColumnChange();
00108         dropColumn1Change.setSchemaName(schemaName);
00109         dropColumn1Change.setTableName(getTableName());
00110         dropColumn1Change.setColumnName(getColumn1Name());
00111         statements.addAll(Arrays.asList(dropColumn1Change.generateStatements(database)));
00112 
00113         DropColumnChange dropColumn2Change = new DropColumnChange();
00114         dropColumn2Change.setSchemaName(schemaName);
00115         dropColumn2Change.setTableName(getTableName());
00116         dropColumn2Change.setColumnName(getColumn2Name());
00117         statements.addAll(Arrays.asList(dropColumn2Change.generateStatements(database)));
00118 
00119         return statements.toArray(new SqlStatement[statements.size()]);
00120 
00121     }
00122 
00123     public SqlStatement[] generateStatements(@SuppressWarnings("unused") DerbyDatabase database) throws UnsupportedChangeException {
00124         throw new UnsupportedChangeException("Derby does not currently support merging columns");
00125     }
00126 
00127     public String getConfirmationMessage() {
00128         return "Columns "+getTableName()+"."+getColumn1Name()+" and "+getTableName()+"."+getColumn2Name()+" merged";
00129     }
00130 
00131     public Element createNode(Document currentChangeLogFileDOM) {
00132         Element element = currentChangeLogFileDOM.createElement(getTagName());
00133         if (getSchemaName() != null) {
00134             element.setAttribute("schemaName", getSchemaName());
00135         }
00136 
00137         element.setAttribute("tableName", getTableName());
00138         element.setAttribute("column1Name", getColumn1Name());
00139         element.setAttribute("joinString", getJoinString());
00140         element.setAttribute("column2Name", getColumn2Name());
00141         element.setAttribute("finalColumnName", getFinalColumnName());
00142         element.setAttribute("finalColumnType", getFinalColumnType());
00143 
00144         return element;
00145     }
00146 
00147     public Set<DatabaseObject> getAffectedDatabaseObjects() {
00148         Set<DatabaseObject> returnSet = new HashSet<DatabaseObject>();
00149         Table table = new Table(getTableName());
00150         returnSet.add(table);
00151 
00152         Column column1 = new Column();
00153         column1.setTable(table);
00154         column1.setName(column1Name);
00155         returnSet.add(column1);
00156 
00157         Column column2 = new Column();
00158         column2.setTable(table);
00159         column2.setName(column2Name);
00160         returnSet.add(column2);
00161 
00162         return returnSet;
00163     }
